author: USA TODAY
title: These pop-culture finales really weren't
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs These pop-culture finales really weren't Brian Truitt , USA TODAY 10:46 a.m. ET Jan. 26, 2017 CLOSE Milla Jovovich stars in the video-game adaptation 'Resident Evil: The Final Chapter.' Sony Milla Jovovich stars in 'Resident Evil: The Final Chapter.' (Photo: Screen Gems) 219 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
In pop culture, finales can be more threat than promise, and often endings just don’t take. 
The next one comes Friday with Resident Evil: The Final Chapter, the sixth and (supposedly) last film installment in the video-game adaptation that pits Milla Jovovich’s heroine Alice in a climactic battle against the evil Umbrella Corporation. That is, until the inevitable reboot or sequel because, like horror-movie villains, genre franchises are often hard to kill. 
But music, books and TV are equally awash with entertaining examples that rose from their dead — sometimes literally. Here are some that have proven harder than others to stay final: 
Gene Simmons of Kiss performs live in Australia in 2013. (Photo: Paul Kane, Getty Images) 
THE KISS FAREWELL TOUR 
Following a highly successful reunion tour in 1996 and 1997, the classic makeup-clad lineup of Gene Simmons, Paul Stanley, Ace Frehley and Peter Criss embarked on a lengthy Farewell world trek. But a funny thing happened on the way to retirement: In 2002, the band unretired and have since done numerous tours (though Simmons and Stanley are the only remaining original members), been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and even bought a now-defunct L.A. arena football team. Those Kiss caskets and pinball machines don’t just sell themselves, you know. 
Jason Voorhees (Kane Hodder) is on a rampage in 'Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday.' (Photo: New Line Cinema) 
FRIDAY THE 13TH 
Starring the machete-wielding, hockey-masked Jason Voorhees, the Friday the 13th horror franchise has had two “final” films: 1984’s The Final Chapter and 1993’s Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday . Usually going to hell will put the kibosh on future endeavors, yet Jason later went to space (in 2002's Jason X ), met Freddy Krueger (2003's Freddy vs. Jason ) and has been rebooted not once but twice, with 2009's Friday the 13th and another one — which happens to be the 13th Friday — that arrives Oct. 13.
